alert.note: Alert for Moore (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 26 at 10:45PM EDT until June 27 at 12:00AM EDT by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 145 AM EDT TUESDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of central North Carolina, including the following counties, Chatham, Harnett, Johnston, Lee, Moore and Wake. * WHEN...Until 145 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1045 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Cary, Sanford, Pittsboro, Lillington, Carthage, Siler City, Garner, Fuquay-Varina, Clayton, Dunn, Angier, Goldston, Apex, Holly Springs, Erwin, Whispering Pines, Coats, Broadway, Vass and Cameron. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
